recipe.name: Cheddar Corn Casserole
recipe.blurb: Mmmm … Cheddar Corn Casserole. You can dress this favorite however you like by adding bacon, ham, bell pepper or crackers.

ingredients.ingredient: 4 cans (15.25 oz. each) Del Monte® Whole Kernel Corn, well drained
1-1/2 cups croutons or crackers, finely crushed (optional)

directions.direction: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix together cheese, flour and pepper in a medium bowl; set aside.
Stir together milk, cream cheese, 1/3 cup green onions and hot sauce in a 9” x 13” baking dish. Add corn and shredded cheese mixture; stir well to blend evenly. Cover and bake 30 minutes.
Uncover and sprinkle remaining 1/3 cup green onions and optional toppings, as desired. Bake 5 minutes longer.

recipe.name: Ultimate Creamy Mashed Potatoes
recipe.blurb: The secret to making these potatoes extra-flavorful is cooking them in chicken broth. Then they're mashed until perfectly smooth and creamy with just the right amount of butter, cream and pepper.

ingredients.ingredient: 3-1/2 cups Swanson® Chicken Broth (Regular, Natural Goodness® or Certified Organic)
5 large potatoes (about 2-1/2 lbs.), peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces (about 7-1/2 cups)

directions.direction: Heat the broth and potatoes in a 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat to a boil.
Reduce the heat to medium. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Drain the potatoes well in a colander, reserving the broth.
Mash the potatoes with 1/4 cup reserved broth, the cream, butter and black pepper. Add additional reserved broth, if needed, until desired consistency.

recipe.name: Green Bean Casserole
recipe.blurb: Feeding a crowd? What's better than green bean casserole, with its flavorful combination of cream of mushroom soup, green beans and crispy French-fried onions?

ingredients.ingredient: 2 cans (10.75 oz. each) Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup (Regular, 98% Fat Free or Healthy Request®)
8 cups cooked green beans or 4 cans (14.5 oz. each) any style Del Monte® Green Beans, drained

directions.direction: Stir the soup, milk, soy sauce, black pepper, beans and 1-1/3 cups onions in a 3-quart casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes or until the bean mixture is hot and bubbling. Stir the bean mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining onions.
Bake for 5 minutes or until the onions are golden brown.

recipe.name: Brown Sugar Bacon Green Beans
recipe.blurb: The title of this recipe speaks for itself! Three of your favorite foods, all rolled up into one.

ingredients.ingredient: 2 cans (14.5 oz. each) Del Monte® Cut Green Beans, well-drained

directions.direction: Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat about 5 minutes or until crisp. Place bacon on paper towels. Discard all but 1 tablespoon of the bacon drippings. (If using turkey bacon, replace drippings with 1 tablespoon canola oil.)
Return skillet to medium-high heat; add beans, sugar and pepper flakes. Cook 6 to 7 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
Top beans with crumbled bacon before serving.

recipe.name: Classic Green Bean Casserole
recipe.blurb: Whether it’s for an Easter dinner or an everyday get-together, this dish quickly became a classic for its combo of creaminess and crunch.

ingredients.ingredient: 1 (10.75-oz.) can Campbell's® Cream of Mushroom Soup
4 cups cooked green beans or 2 cans (14.5 oz. each) any style Del Monte® Green Beans, drained

directions.direction: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Stir the soup, milk, soy sauce, black pepper, beans and 2/3 cup onions in a 1-1/2-quart casserole.
Bake for 25 minutes or until the bean mixture is hot and bubbling. Stir the bean mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining onions.
Bake for 5 minutes or until the onions are golden brown.

recipe.name: Crunchy Onion Chicken & Noodle Dinner
recipe.blurb: Chicken, veggies, noodles and that signature crunch of French's® French Fried Onions combine for a dinner you’ll love.

ingredients.ingredient: 1 (10.75-oz.) can Campbell's® Cream of Chicken Soup
2 cups (4 oz.) French's® Original French Fried Onions
1 cup frozen vegetables of your choice
2 cups cubed, cooked chicken or turkey
2 cups curly egg noodles, cooked and drained

directions.direction: Stir soup, milk, 1 cup French-fried onions, vegetables, chicken, noodles and 1/2 cup cheese in a 2-quart baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes or until hot. Stir.
Top with remaining cheese and French-fried onions. Bake 5 minutes until onions are golden.

recipe.name: Crunchy Onion Mashed Potatoes
recipe.blurb: Add French's® French Fried Onions and crunch up your mashed potatoes.

ingredients.ingredient: 1-1/3 cups (2.8 oz.) French's® Original or Cheddar French Fried Onions

directions.direction: Mix mashed potatoes, sour cream, milk and garlic powder.
Spoon half the mixture into 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with 2/3 cup French-fried onions and 1/2 cup cheese. Top with remaining potato mixture.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes or until hot. Top with remaining 2/3 cup French-fried onions and 1/2 cup cheese. Bake 5 minutes or until onions are golden.

recipe.name: Moist and Savory Stuffing
recipe.blurb: Four ingredients and a dash of pepper mix together quickly to make this baked stuffing — it's delicious as-is, but it's also a great foundation recipe that you can customize with your family's favorite add-ins.

ingredients.ingredient: 1 (14-oz.) pkg. Pepperidge Farm® Herb Seasoned Stuffing

directions.direction: Heat the broth, black pepper, celery and onion in a 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender, stirring often. Remove the saucepan from the heat. Add the stuffing and mix lightly.
Spoon the stuffing mixture into a greased 3-quart shallow baking dish. Cover the baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes or until the stuffing mixture is hot.

recipe.name: Old-Fashioned Stuffing
recipe.blurb: This old-fashioned stuffing recipe has a delicious taste that has withstood the test of time.

ingredients.ingredient: 1 (14-oz.) pkg. Pepperidge Farm® Herb Seasoned Stuffing

directions.direction: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease 3-quart baking dish; set aside. Melt butter in large pot; stir in vegetables and saute for 5 minutes.
Add stuffing to pot and pour broth and water over mixture; stir until moistened. Add French-fried onions and gently mix together. Spoon stuffing into baking dish.
Cover; bake for 10 minutes. Uncover, sprinkle with remaining 1 cup onions. Bake, uncovered, 5 minutes or until onions are golden.

recipe.name: Quick & Crunchy Mac & Cheese
recipe.blurb: This simple-to-make version of macaroni and cheese adds a cheesy crunch to the classic.

ingredients.ingredient: 1-1/3 cups (2.8 oz.) French's® Original or Cheddar French Fried Onions
1 (15-oz.) jar cheddar cheese sauce (microwave 1 minutes to thin sauce)
3 cups cooked tube-shaped pasta (1-1/2 cups uncooked)
2 cups shredded cheddar or cubed American cheese

directions.direction: Heat oven to 350°F. Lightly crush French-fried onions in plastic bag using hands or rolling pin.
Mix cheese sauce and milk in greased 2-quart baking dish. Stir in pasta and 1 cup cheese.
Bake 25 minutes or until heated through. Stir.
Top with remaining 1 cup cheese and onions. Bake 5 minutes until golden.

recipes.recipe:
Turkey Noodle Casserole TurkeyNoodleCasserole 8 20 minutes 35 minutes
This comforting casserole is similar to classic tuna noodle casserole, but it uses turkey instead. It's a flavorful way to use leftovers, or to satisfy those who don't like tuna.
2 cans (10.75 oz. each) Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free) 1 cup milk 2 cups frozen peas 2 cups cubed cooked turkey 1/2 of a 12-oz. pkg. medium egg noodles (about 4 cups), cooked and drained 2 Tbsp. plain dry bread crumbs 1 Tbsp. butter, melted
Stir the soup, milk, peas, turkey and noodles in a 3-quart casserole. Stir the bread crumbs and butter in a small bowl. Bake the turkey mixture at 400°F for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbling. Stir the turkey mixture. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake for 5 minutes or until the bread crumb mixture is golden brown.
Featuredcrunc none none

recipe.name: Turkey and Stuffing Casserole
recipe.blurb: Here's a family-friendly dish that fits right into your busy schedule. It features ingredients that combine with cooked turkey or chicken to make a mouthwatering casserole that's ready in less than 45 minutes.

ingredients.ingredient: 1 (10.75-oz.) can Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
1 (16-oz.) bag frozen vegetable combination (broccoli, cauliflower, carrots), thawed
2 cups cubed cooked turkey or chicken
4 cups Pepperidge Farm® Herb Seasoned Stuffing
1 cup shredded Swiss or cheddar cheese (about 4 oz.)

directions.direction: Heat the oven to 400°F. Spray a 2-quart casserole with the cooking spray.
Stir the soup and milk in a large bowl. Add the vegetables, turkey and stuffing and mix lightly. Spoon the turkey mixture into the casserole.
Bake for 20 minutes or until the turkey mixture is hot and bubbling. Stir the turkey mixture. Top with the cheese.
Bake for 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted.
